alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 2:36PM MST until January 05 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Areas of blowing and drifting snow expected. Wind gusts up to 45 MPH. Expect frequent visibility reductions to three quarters of a mile or less. * WHERE...Central and Northern Carbon and Albany Counties including Rawlins, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, and the northern Laramie Range. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions. Blowing snow may result in significantly reduced visibilities and localized whiteout conditions at times. Moderate drifting may yield icy and possibly snow covered roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin
